Class GenericClient

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.Network.Client.GenericClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualServer, Serializable, Remote
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericClientExtended, RMIClient, SocketClient
public abstract class GenericClient extends UnicastRemoteObject implements VirtualServer

  • Field Details

    • inputManager

      protected InputManager inputManager
      Manages input operations and interactions for the client. Acts as a bridge between the client and its input-related functionalities. Initialized during the construction of the client class and can be used to set up input-related models or tasks.

    • nickName

      protected String nickName
      Represents the nickname associated with the client. This value is used to identify the client within the application.

    • view

      protected static LittleModelRepresentation view
      A static reference to a LittleModelRepresentation object used within the application. This variable is shared across all instances of the enclosing class. It is intended to represent or maintain a simplified state or model representation, serving as an abstraction of the application's data model.

    • uuid

      protected UUID uuid
      A unique identifier for the instance of the GenericClient class. This UUID is automatically generated during the instantiation of the object and is used for identifying the instance uniquely among multiple clients.

    • games

      protected Map<Integer,UUID> games
      A map that associates game identifiers with their corresponding UUIDs. The key represents the game's unique identifier (an integer), and the value represents the UUID of the game instance or reference associated with that identifier. This map is typically used to track and manage multiple game sessions or instances within the containing class.

  • Constructor Details

    • GenericClient

      public GenericClient() throws RemoteException
      Constructs a GenericClient instance and initializes its InputManager.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs during the creation of the GenericClient instance.

  • Method Details

    • getGames

      public Map<Integer,UUID> getGames()
      Retrieves the collection of game mappings where the key represents an integer ID and the value represents the corresponding UUID of a game.
      Returns:
      a map containing game IDs associated with their respective UUIDs

    • getUuid

      public UUID getUuid()
      Retrieves the UUID associated with this instance of the GenericClient.
      Returns:
      the UUID of this GenericClient

    • setUuid

      public void setUuid(UUID uuid)
      Updates the UUID associated with this client.
      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID to be set for this client

    • setview

      public void setview(LittleModelRepresentation view)
      Sets the view for the GenericClient.
      Parameters:
      view - the LittleModelRepresentation instance to be set as the current view

    • getview

      public LittleModelRepresentation getview()
      Retrieves the current shared LittleModelRepresentation view.
      Returns:
      the shared LittleModelRepresentation instance representing the view.

    • setModelToInputManager

      public void setModelToInputManager(LittleModelRepresentation view)
      Sets the given model representation to the InputManager.
      Parameters:
      view - the LittleModelRepresentation object to set in the InputManager

    • isUsernameAccepted

      public boolean isUsernameAccepted()
      Checks whether the username provided to the system is accepted. This method typically evaluates the username against specific validation rules or criteria.
      Returns:
      true if the username is accepted, false otherwise.

    • isUsernameRejected

      public boolean isUsernameRejected()
      Determines whether the username has been rejected.
      Returns:
      true if the username is rejected, false otherwise

    • resetUsernameFlags

      public void resetUsernameFlags()
      Resets the state or flags related to username validation or processing within the client. This method is typically used to clear any previous state regarding username acceptance or rejection, preparing the system for a fresh username handling operation. Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the method is not implemented.
